verses.text: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, she came to prove him with hard questions.

And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train , with camels that bare spices , and very much gold , and precious stones : and when she was come to Solomon , she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
And Solomon told her all her questions : there was not \add any\add* thing hid from the king , which he told her not.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft questions: Heb. words\f*
And when the queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon’s wisdom , and the house that he had built ,

And the meat of his table , and the sitting of his servants , and the attendance of his ministers , and their apparel , and his cupbearers , and his ascent by which he went up unto the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; there was no more spirit in her.\f + \fr 10.5 \ft attendance: Heb. standing\f*\f + \fr 10.5 \ft cupbearers: or, butlers\f*
And she said to the king , It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom.\f + \fr 10.6 \ft report: Heb. word\f*\f + \fr 10.6 \ft acts: or, sayings\f*

Howbeit I believed not the words , until I came , and mine eyes had seen \add it:\add* and, behold, the half was not told me: thy wisdom and prosperity exceedeth the fame which I heard.\f + \fr 10.7 \ft thy…: Heb. thou hast added wisdom and goodness to\f*
Happy \add are\add* thy men , happy \add are\add* these thy servants , which stand continually before thee, \add and\add* that hear thy wisdom.

Blessed be the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God , which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel : because the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* loved Israel for ever , therefore made he thee king , to do judgment and justice.

And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold , and of spices very great store , and precious stones : there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
And the navy also of Hiram , that brought gold from Ophir , brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees , and precious stones.\f + \fr 10.11 \ft almug…: also called, algum trees\f*

And the king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and for the king’s house , harps also and psalteries for singers : there came no such almug trees , nor were seen unto this day.\f + \fr 10.12 \ft pillars: or, rails: Heb. a prop\f*

And king Solomon gave unto the queen of Sheba all her desire , whatsoever she asked , beside \add that\add* which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own country , she and her servants.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft of his…: Heb. according to the hand of king Solomon\f* \p
¶ Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold ,

Beside \add that he had\add* of the merchantmen , and of the traffick of the spice merchants , and of all the kings of Arabia , and of the governors of the country.\f + \fr 10.15 \ft governors: or, captains\f* \p
¶ And king Solomon made two hundred targets \add of\add* beaten gold : six hundred \add shekels\add* of gold went to one target.
And \add he made\add* three hundred shields \add of\add* beaten gold ; three pound of gold went to one shield : and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon. \p
¶ Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory , and overlaid it with the best gold.

The throne had six steps , and the top of the throne \add was\add* round behind : and \add there were\add* stays on either side on the place of the seat , and two lions stood beside the stays.\f + \fr 10.19 \ft behind: Heb. on the hinder part thereof\f*\f + \fr 10.19 \ft stays: Heb. hands\f*
And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps : there was not the like made in any kingdom.\f + \fr 10.20 \ft the like: Heb. so\f* \p

¶ And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels \add were of\add* gold , and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon \add were of\add* pure gold ; none \add were of\add* silver : it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.\f + \fr 10.21 \ft none…: or, there was no silver in them\f*

For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram : once in three years came the navy of Tharshish , bringing gold , and silver , ivory , and apes , and peacocks.\f + \fr 10.22 \ft ivory: or, elephants’ teeth\f*
So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom. \p
¶ And all the earth sought to Solomon , to hear his wisdom , which God had put in his heart.\f + \fr 10.24 \ft sought to: Heb. sought the face of\f*
And they brought every man his present , vessels of silver , and vessels of gold , and garments , and armour , and spices , horses , and mules , a rate year by year. \p

¶ And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen : and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots , and twelve thousand horsemen , whom he bestowed in the cities for chariots , and with the king at Jerusalem.

And the king made silver \add to be\add* in Jerusalem as stones , and cedars made he \add to be\add* as the sycomore trees that \add are\add* in the vale , for abundance.\f + \fr 10.27 \ft made: Heb. gave\f* \p

¶ And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt , and linen yarn : the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.\f + \fr 10.28 \ft And Solomon…: Heb. And the going forth of the horses which was Solomon’s\f*

And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred \add shekels\add* of silver , and an horse for an hundred and fifty : and so for all the kings of the Hittites , and for the kings of Syria , did they bring \add them\add* out by their means.\f + \fr 10.29 \ft by their…: Heb. by their hand\f*
